comment.author: 17264356@N00
comment._content: Samuel Seabury was a New York State judge in the 1910s, and in 1916 resigned to seek the governorship. In the early thirties he lead the Seabury Commission that investigated and cleaned up corruption in New York City courts.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: In 1913, Seabury was the unsuccessful Progressive Party candidate for an Associate Justice vacancy on the New York State Court of Appeals. The photo bears Bain's date of August 7, 1913 -- perhaps the time when Seabury announced his candidacy.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Eli the Bearded and Wystan,

Thanks for the additional details on Mr. Seabury. We'll expand the record when we update.
